title: mystyles.scss
Bianca Berron
text: My name is Bianca Berron and I’m a second year Environmental Studies (B.S) student at UCSB! Some of my involvements on campus include being on the UCSB Surf Team, Environmental Affairs Board, and the Gaucho Tour Association.

title: Bianca Berron
text:
Education
B.S in Environmental Studies (June 2025)
University of California Santa Barbara

title: About
text:
About this site
In this site you can find some of my proudest work I have completed during my time here at UCSB so far. Each page on this website leads to a different project I have completed over the past two years at UCSB.

title: Surfing!
text:
Growing up in San Diego, I learned to surf at a young age. Being out in the water is unlike anything else, and is one of my outlets from school. There is something incredibly special about being in the ocean and riding waves. I’m very grateful to have grown up where I did.

I’ve also been lucky to have my surfing photographed by my sister, Erika. She takes photos of my dad, brother, and I which I am so thankful for.

Below is a collage of some of my most favorite surf photos:



All of these photos are taken at Beacons Beach, my homebreak.

title: Coding Progress
text:
Throughout my ENVS 193DS course (which I am taking right now), an environmental data science class, I have learned how to code using RStudio.
The process of coding has been difficult, however, I feel as though I have made significant progress, particularly in creating data visualizations. Below are some of the data visualizations I have created in chronological order, from the first visualization I created to my most recent.



This was the first visualization I ever created for my first homework assignment to show annual sea level rise. 4/17/2023





For this figure, I learned how to use the facet_wrap function to break up a plot into different panels. 4/25/2023





This figure is my most recent data visualization and portrays how ice duration of lakes is decreasing over time. 5/14/2023
